alert.note: Alert for Grant; Sierra (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 1:16PM MDT until July 11 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Black Fire Burn Scar in... Western Sierra County in south central New Mexico... Northern Grant County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 116 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Black Fire Burn Scar. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the South Diamond Creek and Black Canyon. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Black Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Black Fire Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Sierra and Northern Grant Counties This includes the following streams and drainages... Baily Creek, Sheep Creek, Morgan Creek, Hoyt Creek, South Diamond Creek and Black Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Black Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
